Back to Protoss Builds

Dark Templar Rush

Matchup: All matchups

Difficulty: Intermediate

A cheese strategy that can win games quickly if the opponent lacks detection. This high-risk, high-reward build focuses on getting cloaked Dark Templars to the enemy base before they can prepare adequate defenses.

Build Order

  1. 9 Pylon
  2. 13 Gateway
  3. 15 Assimilator
  4. 16 Pylon
  5. 18 Cybernetics Core
  6. 20 Assimilator
  7. 21 Zealot
  8. 22 Dark Shrine
  9. 24 Gateway
  10. @Cyber: Warpgate Research
  11. @Shrine: Dark Templar x2
  12. Continue DT production
  13. Add more Gateways if successful

Execution Guide

Opening (0-4 minutes)

  • Execute standard gateway opening
  • Take gas early for Dark Shrine
  • Scout opponent's tech choices
  • Hide your tech path from enemy scouts

Tech Phase (4-6 minutes)

  • Build Dark Shrine in hidden location
  • Chronoboost Dark Shrine if needed
  • Add second Gateway
  • Continue Probe production
  • Scout for enemy detection preparations

Attack Phase (6+ minutes)

  • Attack with first 2 Dark Templars
  • Target workers and key buildings
  • Continuously warp in more DTs
  • Retreat if enemy gets detection

Key Strategic Points

  • Stealth is Critical: Hide Dark Shrine from scouts
  • Detection Check: Constantly scout for enemy detection
  • Target Priority: Workers > Production > Tech buildings
  • Timing: Hit before detection is ready
  • All-in Commitment: Must deal significant damage

Matchup Specific Strategy

vs Terran

Targets & Timing

  • SCVs, production buildings
  • Hit before Turrets are built
  • Avoid Marines and Scans

Watch For

  • Engineering Bays, Missile Turrets
  • Follow-up: Gateway units or tech transition

vs Protoss

Targets & Timing

  • Probes, Pylons, tech buildings
  • Hit before Observer completes
  • Avoid Photon Cannons

Watch For

  • Robotics Facility, Observers
  • Follow-up: All-in or defensive play

vs Zerg

Targets & Timing

  • Drones, Queens, Overlords
  • Hit before Lair tech or Spores
  • Avoid Queen anti-air

Watch For

  • Spore Crawlers, Overseers
  • Follow-up: All-in or macro transition

Dark Templar Micro Techniques

Worker Harassment

  • Target Selection: Focus on mineral line workers
  • Movement: Keep DTs moving to avoid splash damage
  • Hit and Run: Kill workers then retreat to safety
  • Multiple Bases: Attack different locations simultaneously

Building Targeting

  • Priority: Tech buildings > Production > Economy
  • Quick Kills: Focus fire to destroy buildings fast
  • Escape Routes: Always have an exit strategy
  • Detection Avoidance: Retreat when detection arrives

Combat Micro

  • Focus Fire: Target single units for quick kills
  • Positioning: Attack from multiple angles
  • Retreat Timing: Leave before taking heavy damage
  • Warp-ins: Reinforce with more DTs if successful

Common Mistakes

  • Building Dark Shrine in visible location
  • Not scouting for enemy detection
  • Attacking before having enough DTs
  • Poor micro - losing DTs unnecessarily
  • Not following up with more units
  • Staying too long when detection arrives
  • Not having a backup plan if rush fails
  • Forgetting to continue Probe production

Advanced Tips

  • Build Dark Shrine behind minerals or in corners
  • Use Probe to scout for detection before attacking
  • Consider Blink research for better DT mobility
  • Attack multiple locations if you have 4+ DTs
  • Use DTs to deny opponent's expansion attempts
  • Combine with Zealot pressure for distraction

Transition Options

If Rush Succeeds

  • Continue DT production and harassment
  • Add more Gateways for Gateway all-in
  • Take expansion behind the pressure
  • Transition to standard macro play

If Rush Fails

  • Focus on economy and standard tech
  • Use DTs for occasional harassment only
  • Prepare for opponent's counter-attack
  • Transition to Robotics or Stargate tech

Counters and How to Avoid Them

Common Counters

  • Static Detection: Turrets, Cannons, Spores - attack elsewhere
  • Mobile Detection: Observers, Overseers - focus fire detector
  • Early Rush: Be prepared with Zealots and good micro
  • Mass Units: Retreat and look for better opportunities

Chronoboost Priority

  1. Probes: Maintain economy during tech rush
  2. Dark Shrine: Get DTs faster
  3. Warpgate Research: For faster reinforcements
  4. Dark Templars: If you need them urgently
